title: Introduction to org
text: main function sets project structure. takes 2+ arguments saves folder locations org::project use throughout analysis: home: Location Run.R R/ folder (accessible via org::project$home) results: Results folder creates date-based subfolders (accessible via org::project$results_today) ...: Additional folders needed (e.g., data_raw, data_clean)

title: Introduction to org
text: main analysis script orchestrates entire workflow: Data cleaning Analysis Result generation code sections encapsulated functions R/ folder. multiple main files, creates confusion returning code later. However, can versioned files (e.g., Run_v01.R, Run_v02.R) later versions supersede earlier ones.

title: Introduction to org
text: analysis functions defined org::project$home/R. initialize_project function automatically sources R scripts directory.

title: Introduction to org
text: ’s complete example structure project:
code: # Initialize the project org::initialize_project(   env = .GlobalEnv,   home = "/git/analyses/2019/analysis3/",   results = "/dropbox/analyses_results/2019/analysis3/",   data_raw = "/data/analyses/2019/analysis3/" )  # Document changes in archived results txt <- glue::glue("   2019-01-01:     Included:     - Table 1     - Table 2      2019-02-02:     Changed Table 1 from mean -> median ", .trim=FALSE)  org::write_text(   txt = txt,   file = fs::path(org::project$results, "info.txt") )  # Load required packages library(data.table) library(ggplot2)  # Run analysis d <- clean_data()  # Accesses data from org::project$data_raw table_1(d)         # Saves to org::project$results_today figure_1(d)        # Saves to org::project$results_today figure_2(d)        # Saves to org::project$results_today

title: Introduction to org
text: writing research articles, often need multiple versions (initial submission, resubmissions). org helps manage using date-based versioning: Rename Run.R Run_YYYY_MM_DD_submission_1.R Rename R/ R_YYYY_MM_DD_submission_1/ Create new files updated dates Keep old versions reference preserves code produced results submission, ensuring changes deliberate intentional.

title: Introduction to org
text: Store project components appropriate locations:
code: # Code (GitHub) git/ └── analyses/     ├── 2018/     │   ├── analysis_1/          # org::project$home     │   │   ├── Run.R     │   │   └── R/     │   │       ├── clean_data.R     │   │       ├── descriptives.R     │   │       ├── analysis.R     │   │       └── figure_1.R     │   └── analysis_2/     └── 2019/         └── analysis_3/  # Results (Dropbox) dropbox/ └── analyses_results/     ├── 2018/     │   ├── analysis_1/          # org::project$results     │   │   ├── 2018-03-12/     # org::project$results_today     │   │   │   ├── table_1.xlsx     │   │   │   └── figure_1.png     │   │   ├── 2018-03-15/     │   │   └── 2018-03-18/     │   └── analysis_2/     └── 2019/         └── analysis_3/  # Data (Local) data/ └── analyses/     ├── 2018/     │   ├── analysis_1/          # org::project$data_raw     │   │   └── data.xlsx     │   └── analysis_2/     └── 2019/         └── analysis_3/

title: Organising Projects
text: org framework organizing R projects standardized structure. helps manage three main components analyses: Code: Version-controlled analysis scripts Results: Date-organized output files Data: Securely stored input data component specific requirements best practices org helps enforce. package provides tools : Set manage project directories Handle file paths consistently across operating systems Manage results date-based organization Source code specified directories Create manage Quarto documents Handle file operations safely
